documentType: bureau of prisons count sheet and inmate roster
summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 12-13, 2019. It includes inmate count sheets, an out-count form, and an inmate roster showing assignments, including two inmates assigned to a hospital (HOSP) unit. The documents reflect standard prison administrative procedures around inmate tracking and counts.

persons.name: Gama-Pineda
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85918-054, assigned to the hospital (HOSP) unit on the inmate roster dated August 12, 2019.

persons.name: Torres
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85621-054, assigned to the hospital (HOSP) unit on the inmate roster dated August 12, 2019.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count and Roster Update
events.description: Standard administrative inmate counts and roster updates were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. The count sheet shows a total inmate population of 765, verified as 763. An inmate roster shows assignments, including two inmates to a hospital unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 12-13, 2019, placing them the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The inmate count shows a total population of 765 inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York).
An inmate roster lists two inmates, Gama-Pineda and Torres, as assigned to a hospital (HOSP) unit.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms for tracking inmate counts and assignments.
A transaction for applying future assignments was rejected on August 13, 2019, because future assignments already existed from August 9, 2019.
